Welcome To Pitchers University!
Tell Me More

Biomechanics Analysis

This analysis captures every detail of your pitching motion, tracking joint angles, rotation speed, and balance. By identifying inefficiencies, we can fine-tune your delivery to unlock more speed, accuracy, and consistency.

Smart Conditioning

Building strength, flexibility, and endurance through a solid training program helps your body produce more power, which translates to increased velocity. Strengthening key muscle groups like your legs, core, and shoulders will give you the explosiveness you need to throw faster with less effort.

Velocity Development

Improving your pitching velocity isn't just about throwing harder—it's about throwing smarter. By focusing on proper conditioning and mechanics, you can increase your velocity by up to 5 mph and keep your arm safe from injury.

About Coach Felipe Suarez

College, Professional & National Team Experience

A Proven Leader in Pitching Development

Coach Felipe Suarez brings decades of elite pitching experience to the field, combining a standout collegiate career, professional success, and extensive coaching at the college, national, and professional levels. A proud Nova Southeastern alumnus, Suarez starred for the program from 1996–1998, earning Florida Sun Conference Player of the Year honors in 1997 after winning 11 games and striking out 114 batters. He remains one of the top pitchers in NSU history, holding records for complete games and single‑season strikeouts.

After college, Suarez signed with the Anaheim Angels organization, rising quickly through the system and reaching AAA Edmonton in just his second full season. He appeared in 91 minor league games and was part of the 2001 Texas League Championship team with the Arkansas Travelers.

Suarez transitioned into coaching in 2002 and has since built a reputation as one of South Florida’s premier pitching instructors. His résumé includes roles with Broward College, Florida International University, and USA Baseball, where he served as pitching coach for the U16 National Team that won the 2007 World Championship in Venezuela. He also coached in the Los Angeles Angels’ Rookie and Instructional Leagues, further sharpening his player‑development expertise.

In 2003, Suarez cofounded the X Team organization, a development‑driven travel baseball program that quickly became one of the most respected in the Southeast. The inaugural roster produced four MLB players and eight additional professional athletes, and the program has since helped more than 100 players advance to the collegiate or professional ranks. The X Team expanded in 2020 with a thriving youth division built on the same principles of instruction, accountability, and long‑term development.

Returning to NSU in 2011 as pitching coach, Suarez continued to shape pitchers through a blend of experience, passion, and a deep understanding of the game. After his time at NSU, he shifted his focus toward private instruction, allowing him to work more closely with individual athletes and dedicate his full attention to their long‑term development. His athletes benefit from a coaching philosophy grounded in discipline, biomechanics, and a commitment to sustainable growth.
